title: unesco_heritage_Ħal_Saflieni_Hypogeum
text:
Name: Ħal Saflieni Hypogeum. short_description:

The Hypogeum is an enormous subterranean structure excavated c. 2500 B.C., using cyclopean rigging to lift huge blocks of coralline limestone. Perhaps originally a sanctuary, it became a necropolis in prehistoric times.

. date_inscribed: 1980. danger: 0. date_end: . longitude: 14.50739. latitude: 35.87134. area_hectares: 0.13. category_long: Cultural. category_short: C. Country name: Malta. Region: Europe and North America. iso_code: mt. transboundary: 0. rev_bis: .
